unit.label: Act III, Scene III
unit.title: SCENE III. Florence. Before the Duke’s palace.

conventions.dash_policy: classify em/en/hyphen as separate tokens; all dash types normalize to "-"
conventions.bracket_policy: strip underscores and outer brackets from stage spans

spans.text: SCENE III. Florence. Before the Duke’s palace.
Flourish. Enter the Duke of Florence, Bertram, drum and trumpets,
The general of our horse thou art, and we,
Great in our hope, lay our best love and credence
A charge too heavy for my strength; but yet
We’ll strive to bear it for your worthy sake
And fortune play upon thy prosperous helm,
Great Mars, I put myself into thy file;
Make me but like my thoughts, and I shall prove
A lover of thy drum, hater of love.
